alert.note: Alert for Coleman; Concho; McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coleman, Concho and McCulloch. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain over far southern Coleman, far northern McCulloch and far northeastern Concho Counties. Rainfall of 1.25 to 1.75 inches has already occurred, and an additional half to three quarters of an inch is likely. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gouldbusk, Waldrip, Rockwood, Stacy, Voss, Leaday, Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina, Shields, Mozelle, Us-283 Near The Mcculloch-Coleman County Line, Fife and Whon. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along County Road 302 and County Road 222 crossing Home Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
